title: Failed to build fftw@2.1.5 due to linking errros: undefined reference to `fftw_reverse_int_array'
body:
I failed to build fftw@2.1.5 against gcc@4.8.5 due to linking errros: undefined reference to `fftw_reverse_int_array'.

### Expected Result

FFTW build succesfully.

### Actual Result

FFTW builds failed.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install fftw~mpi@2.1.5 %gcc@4.8.5
==> Installing fftw
==> Using cached archive: /lustre/home/rpm/spack/var/spack/cache/fftw/fftw-2.1.5.tar.gz
==> Staging archive: /lustre/home/rpm/spack/var/spack/stage/fftw-2.1.5-xlod6u6nbbol2p7aotwsh7467y6q7lnb/fftw-2.1.5.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /lustre/home/rpm/spack/var/spack/stage/fftw-2.1.5-xlod6u6nbbol2p7aotwsh7467y6q7lnb
==> No patches needed for fftw
==> Building fftw [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Executing phase: 'build'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 2:
    'make' '-j6'

4 errors found in build log:
     1575    /bin/sh ../libtool --mode=link /lustre/home/rpm/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc  -O3 -fomit-frame-pointer -fno-schedule-insns -fschedule-insns2 -malign-double -fstr
             ict-aliasing -pthread   -o fftw_test  fftw_test.o test_main.o ../fftw/libdfftw.la -lm
     1576    mkdir .libs
     1577    /lustre/home/rpm/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -O3 -fomit-frame-pointer -fno-schedule-insns -fschedule-insns2 -malign-double -fstrict-aliasing -pthread -o .libs/f
             ftw_test fftw_test.o test_main.o  ../fftw/.libs/libdfftw.so -lm -Wl,--rpath -Wl,/lustre/spack/sandybridge/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/fftw-2.1.5-xlod6u6nbbol
             2p7aotwsh7467y6q7lnb/lib
     1578    creating fftw_test
     1579    /bin/sh ../libtool --mode=link /lustre/home/rpm/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc  -O3 -fomit-frame-pointer -fno-schedule-insns -fschedule-insns2 -malign-double -fstr
             ict-aliasing -pthread   -o rfftw_test  rfftw_test.o test_main.o ../rfftw/libdrfftw.la ../fftw/libdfftw.la -lm
     1580    /lustre/home/rpm/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -O3 -fomit-frame-pointer -fno-schedule-insns -fschedule-insns2 -malign-double -fstrict-aliasing -pthread -o .libs/r
             fftw_test rfftw_test.o test_main.o  ../rfftw/.libs/libdrfftw.so ../fftw/.libs/libdfftw.so -lm -Wl,--rpath -Wl,/lustre/spack/sandybridge/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc
             -4.8.5/fftw-2.1.5-xlod6u6nbbol2p7aotwsh7467y6q7lnb/lib
  >> 1581    ../rfftw/.libs/libdrfftw.so: undefined reference to `fftw_reverse_int_array'
  >> 1582    collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
  >> 1583    make[1]: *** [rfftw_test] Error 1
     1584    make[1]: Leaving directory `/lustre/home/rpm/spack/var/spack/stage/fftw-2.1.5-xlod6u6nbbol2p7aotwsh7467y6q7lnb/fftw-2.1.5/double/tests'
  >> 1585    make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1

See build log for details:
  /lustre/home/rpm/spack/var/spack/stage/fftw-2.1.5-xlod6u6nbbol2p7aotwsh7467y6q7lnb/fftw-2.1.5/spack-build.out
```

### Information on your system

 I run Spack on CentOS 7.3 and GCC 4.8.5. No relevant configuration has been made. Please find full logs attached. 

* Outside Spack, fftw@2.1.5 can be built with the normal `./configure; make; make install` process within the src directory. In Spack, an out-of-source bulding style is applied thus a builidng directory named `double` is created within the source directory.
* I checked the fftw libs built outside Spack, finding that `fftw_reverse_int_array` should be a symbol defined in the shared object `../fftw/.libs/libdfftw.so`. However, for some reason, `../fftw/.libs/libdfftw.so` doesn't contain this symbol when building with Spack.

[spack-build.env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/1775442/spack-build.env.txt)
[spack-build.out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/1775444/spack-build.out.txt)
